newsitem.title: USA: Kimball sees FY97 EPS of $2.65-$2.95/shr.
newsitem.headline: Kimball sees FY97 EPS of $2.65-$2.95/shr.

text.p: Kimball International Inc said Tuesday it anticipates earnings for fiscal 1997 ending in June to be between $2.65 and $2.95 a class B share, up from $2.16 a share reported for fiscal 1996.
Chief executive officer Douglas Habig also told shareholders at the company's annual meeting that revenues in fiscal 1997 should exceed $1 billion, up from $924 million in fiscal 1996.

But Habig cautioned that achievement of the company's growth targets could be materially affected by any number of risks and uncertainties, including competitive pricing pressures, market share gains and losses by third-party contract customers, raw material component inflation, and other unforeseen "macro" factors, the furniture making company said.

Sales gains in the two largest segments - furniture and cabinets and electronic contract assemblies - are expected to exceed 10 percent, Kimball said, adding that those two segments accounted for 94 percent of fiscal year 1996's consolidated revenues.
Kimball shares were unchanged at 35-3/4 Tuesday.
